channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Do you love customers? Senior Perl Developer with a product focus, London
item.description: Ever find yourself wishing you could see meaningful impact on users from your work? Trapped in a company with long release cycles and dubious release dates? Wish your ideas for product improvement didnâ€™t keep disappearing in to the Project Managerâ€™s backlog?

item.title: Independent thinkers required! Mid/Senior-level Developer for an innovative London company
item.description: Have you ever worked for a company with a micromanagement style, where a boss was constantly breathing down your neck? Do you hate spending more time in meetings about product requirements than actually getting on with building the product?

item.title: Perl Mongers of Wimbledon Common Are We - Perl Developer wanted in Wimbledon
item.description: Back in the day, the Wombles of Wimbledon collected rubbish. Nowadays, since the advent of motorised road sweepers, theyâ€™d be in need of a new profession. Perl Developer, perhaps? Our client is based in the heart of Wimbledon, under a mile away from the Common where the Wombles famously made their home.

item.title: TPC: Round 2 Talk Submission Notifications Sent
item.description: Round 3 CFP is still open!

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description:
Great modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report;
StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: Help improving the Perl Maven Tutorial!
item.description: You can help the Perl Maven Tutorial and through that many beginner Perl developer either with the content or with the crowdfunding.

item.title: 2018.10 Pragmatic Perl
item.description: The Week in Perl 6. - All the Russian Pragmatic Perl interviews now available in English. - Tons of blog posts!

item.title: Perl 5 Porters Mailing List Summary: February 19th - March 4th
Delays and Delights - Rakudo Perl 6 performance analysis tooling - Grant Report #1
item.description: Bits and pieces: Non-crashy multi-threaded profiles; Faster Heap Snapshots; Web Frontend; Faster Profile File Writing

item.title: Grant Report : Complete YAML::PP - February 2018
Maintaining the Perl 5 Core (Dave Mitchell): Grant Report for February 2018
January 2018 Grant Votes
item.description: The 'Curating and improving Perl6 documentation' JJ Merelo was approved. All the others rejected. (I am quite surprised that TPF seemed to have taken the proposal seriously. Given the timeline in the proposal was for last year and there was no reply to the comment about this.)

item.title: Set::Jaccard::SimilarityCoefficient v1.6.1 Released
item.description: Set::Jaccard::SimilarityCoefficient can calculate the Jaccard Similarity Coefficient of 2 sets. It is used for comparing the similarity and diversity of sample sets. Can be used to measure how much two images overlap.

item.title: What's new on CPAN - February 2018
item.description: The monthly collection by David. Many new modules worth checking out.

item.title: Forking tests
item.description: How can you make sure that your code, in this case CtrlO::Crypt::XkcdPassword works even if the process forks? For example in a web application. There were two main issues: Initializing the randomness in the parent meant that they generate the same password in all the processes. TAP does not like to be confused. Also, Windows does not like fork.

item.title: Add test coverage reporting with Coveralls to Markua Parser in Perl
item.description: Another step in the Markua parser project to help the Perl Tutorial crowdfunding.

item.title: Using Docker to Check for Prerequisites
item.description: An excellent way to make sure your code can be installed on a clean (or almost clean) Linux box with vanilla Perl. It could also be used to smoke test your module on multiple systems.

item.title: What would you like to see from an ebook on programming the Raspberry Pi in Perl?
item.description: Lots of comments on the web site and on Reddit as well. Do you have a Raspberry Pi at home? They are fun little computers.

item.title: Travis-CI for the Markua Parser project
item.description: Markua is a Markdown-inspired language for writing books created and used by LeanPub. The Markua parser in Perl 5 was started by yours truly to make it easier to use Markua for writing the articles on the Perl Maven site and then to convert them to eBooks. This article shows how to set up Continuous Integration on Travis-CI. The whole project was started to aid the work once the Perl Tutorial Campaign is successful.

item.title: Is this the end of Dist-Zilla?
item.description: John's frenzied pace of postings about Moose and DistZilla continues. Check out his blogs for the newest!

item.title: Perl Toolchain Summit
item.description: April 19 - 22, 2018 Oslo, Norway

item.title: Swiss Perl Workshop
item.description: September 7 - 8, 2018 Bern, Switzerland

item.title: French Perl Workshop
item.description: May 18 - 19, 2018 Paris, France

item.title: The Perl Conference in Europe
item.description: I have not seen any announcement from them outside of their own web site, but nevertheless they deserve to be mentioned: In Glasgow between 15th-17th August. The CFP is still open.

item.title: The Perl Conference Newsletter: 3/11/18
item.description: Round 1 and Round 2 Speakers Announced! Last Call to Submit a Talk! Register today to attend The Perl Conference; Conference Hotel Rooms and Rates; Sponsor The Perl Conference! Stay up to date! - Published on 3/11/18. These Americans will never learn how to write a date properly :)

item.title: A decade of classes in Lausanne
item.description: Wow, these classes are practically free. With Damian. In Switzerland. What else could I want. If I did not have a previous commitment on those days I'd surely go. The low prices will totally offset the extra chocolate I'd eat there.

item.title: GPW2018 - Draft schedule online
item.description: The German Perl Workshop will take place in Gummersbach between 4-6 April 2018.

item.title: #346 - Conferences, Workshops, Training classes
item.description:
Hi there!

there seem to be a small wave of event announcements. If you have not been to any Perl event, I'd recommend you pick one of these.

There are 4 days left from the Perl Maven Tutorial crowdfunding campaign. If we don't reach the goal I will have to extend it and then you will keep hearing about it in every issue for another 6 weeks. You would not want that, would you? For the sake of your and your fellow Perl Weekly readers well being, help me reach the goal! Go and support the campaign now!

Then go and enjoy your week!
item.dc:subject: list of tags?
